Yyw_Ly5cZWAKVbRB5nRd8Q.text: I've been traveling to London on and off for several years. Every time I can I stop at Fishbone for fish and chips - It was introduced to me as the "2nd best chip shop in London" - I think the ranking might be one off though. I've even considered taking a trip to the UK - primarily to eat here. I've taken colleges and even some locals to this place, with the very consistent response of them wanting to go back soon. Excellent food. Reasonable Price (for London)... I'll be back again...

0y6kcMRH7eYFhQr23XuFNA.text: 'Sea Shell'  (Fish & Chips), on Lisson Grove,  was all boarded up for a major renovation and not wanting to go home empty handed I remembered reading about this place.Well, I'm here to tell you it serves very good fish & chips.I took my food home, but there's also a very nice looking restaurant  there as well.Crisp light golden batter. Tasty,  perfect chips. Nice mushy peas. The coleslaw tasted a little sharp, but, nevertheless, was a nice adjunct to the fish and chips.I had to race it all back to W14 and it was still hot enough to eat when I got home.

z8oAcmEVKeZtBlYGGnn3Dw.text: I've lived in the Fitzrovia/Marylebone area for the last 4 months, as a student studying in London for the semester. This place was just a couple blocks from my flat so I went pretty regularly.  This is by far my favorite fish and chips shop in London and not only are their fish and chips superb, but their Taramasalata dip, their meat pies, and their mousse and mascarpone dessert are all amazing as well!  If you happen to be in the Fitzrovia area, definitely stop by!  Their prices are also very cheap, especially considering the area in which they're located.  One of the few places near me I could actually afford!

lQXSANOURP0F6b8qw7JYBQ.text: Before going to London, I was watch a travel show. They talked about The Fish Bone. So on our trip we happen to walk by and decided to try it. Great food. The fish and chips was fresh and huge. Worth the stop.

aeVyfh2zMMw4ZgAyZnM8Aw.text: Quite a good fish and chips as well as a fairly extensive menu. Takeaway prices are quite reasonable and eat in was reasonable. I will be back!

MW86idX1jwcgjku7g7MNRg.text: Granted I'm still very new to London, but this place has fantastic fish and chips.  Actually, I take that back - the fish was fantastic, but the chips were kind of mediocre.  Still, the giant, perfectly-crispy-without-being-greasy fish was more than enough to make up for the lackluster chips.  Aside from the traditionally battered fare, you can have your fish either grilled or breaded with matzo meal.

w02PAv1V8KG7Sli7C_4ZxA.text: A friend had recommended Fish Bone and I'm glad I went (2 years ago)!   I still remember the FISH very well... the lightest "tempura" I've ever had.  And like Dennis, I wasn't too crazy about the chips, but the fish totally makes up for it!  I'd love to go again during lunch.  We went near closing time, but the waiter was super friendly.  The area felt a bit sketchy so it was good to have my partner w/ me, but maybe it's better during the day.  It's equidistant from 2 stations.

cuyi34R_ORFDEeHa46nbaA.text: For my money, probably the best chippie in town. It's a tiny place so if you're hoping to eat in, rather than take away, you may well end up sharing a table with local Fitzrovia workers - but to my mind that's an added bonus. The fish is fresh (try the melt-in-your mouth cod), the batter delectable, the chips are cut to a decent size and the mushy peas are, well, mushy (as opposed to soggy). Wash the lot down with a small glass of wine and you won't get much change from a tenner  but you will feel a whole lot better about life.

9hDJvK0bwp2xuMMLBlSOVA.text: its been a while since i had fish & chips in England but comparing this to past experiences this is definitely some of the best. the chips (fries) are  fantastic - not soggy or greasy. the fried cod is a good piece of fish - good taste and not too greasy. all washed down with a cup of tea. throw in some bread and butter and mushy peas. perfect comfort food for a cold, rainy London day

QJLP-3TCHcJ4z_lktTDOCA.text: Having gone upscale at Sweetings a few days prior, I was ready to find a great local Chippy that won't break the bank.  I walked past this hole in the wall fish and chip shop several times as it was near where I was staying.  Yelp to the rescue and I see Londoners proclaiming it one of the best Fish and Chips places around.  Being an American, I prefer not to have skin on my fish.  I just don't get the whole skin concept.  The batter doesn't stick to the fish, and the skin doesn't get crispy.  It says rather slimy in my book, so I end up picking it off, and along with it all the tasty batter.  Expressing my viewpoint to our very friendly waitress, she promised not to pass judgement on my incorrect assessment and had the chef prepare our fish without skin.  Now keep in mind it was when they first opened, and perhaps during a lunch rush, this extra preparation may not be possible.  I definitely got the impressions the chef was doing us a favor.  For all I know it may have been the first time this request has been made.I had the large piece of Cod, which is politely called the "regular" sized cod on their menu.  It was outstanding and may be the best fried fish I've had.  Yes better than the £26 version I had at Sweetings, although that was Halibut and this was Cod.  But doesn't it really just come down to the batter?  Fish Bone's batter was outstanding.  My wife felt that the fish got kind of greasy, but I had no problem devouring this beautiful piece of fish.  Crunchy on the outside, soft and flaky on the inside, a little malt vinegar and salt.; occasionally dipping in a little tartare sauce.  This was piping hot and made to order.  Don't expect fast food here with the fish laying around.  Most others that I saw come in, had phoned in their order ahead of time.  There is very limited seating here and it's mostly a to go spot.I made another great discovery.  Their batter works great around a deep fried sausage.  These are Halal Beef Sausages.  It had the texture of a banger, so I'm guessing a little creme is added.  Unlike Kosher, I don't think Halal has an issue with milk products added with food.  I could be wrong though.  Whatever it was, it was a very tasty sausage and frying it made it even better.  I wouldn't come here without getting a side of those.So this should be a 5 star rating, but the chips just didn't do it for me.  Since the dish is called Fish and Chips, that's kind of half of the meal.  Fish Bone won some award for their chips as well, as I saw a sign posted saying Winner of the 2012 Best Chippy Chips Award.  I don't know, I found them kind of mushy.  I don't mind a lot of potato to my chips, but these had no crunch on the outside.  They were good to soak up the Malt Vinegar though, so perhaps that's their concept.  To me they were average.  But the fish and sausage was so good here, I still highly recommend Fish Bone.  And at a very reasonable price too.yelp.com/biz_photos/fish…

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Regular Cod, battered Halal Sausage, and chips.

okeyJd_tuCbXd4bHYZ62wA.text: This is our second visit to London and I'm so glad we found Fish Bone so close to where we are staying in the Fitzrovia area. We just found the best, most reasonably priced and least pretentious fish and chips place in London. Portions are on the huge side. I was not able to finish eating a "regular" size portion of cod and chips, and this is after walking around the London Zoo all day and having nothing to eat, but a black coffee that morning. It still tastes good the next day! The fish was fresh and the batter was amazing. Nice and crisp. You can sit and eat either inside or outside (weather permitting) or get take away. We have a 10 month old and a 3 year old, since it was getting to be their bedtime it was nice to have the take away option. It doesn't get much more authentically British than this fish and chips place. Service was fast and friendly. Best fish and chips in London. We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Regular size cod and chips (take away)

1kcvObNgSbgbbLh7j2xT7A.text: Stopped by toward the end of my trip to London.  The best fish and chips I had the entire trip.  Great food, reasonable prices, and great service.

wIfJIQ-AZ0UUqTeKqH-Szg.text: Dear Yelper,  I can't leave well enough alone. Feeling restless over Bank Hols, thought I'd write about Fish Bone.My college friend is visiting me from America, you see? Yes. Showed her my favourite London chippy, like Outkast, so fresh so clean, clean and fresh. Nope it is not Rock and Sole Plaice. So 1993, straight Ace of Base. Toff's of Muswell Hill? I'm sure it's great, but it's not as chill. Gig's? Poppies? The Golden Hind? If you go there after this, you deserve a spanked be-hind. Finally, what's the other place, North Sea?Oh no you didn't! Stay there, and don't send a postcard please. All I'm saying Yelper is, you're outta body and mind. If you ever visited Fish Bone and didn't find it simply divine. So, lemme break it down, a little history. Of how much the joint means to me. Since '09 Fish Bone's been my haunt. And I highly suggest you make a quick jaunt. The dudes behind the counter know me very well. Always ready with a smile, a wink or some good banter: like hair, we gel. Yet always professional, knowledgable and very swift. You'll never be waiting for dinner, which would leave most frowning and miffed.Upon exit, you'll never feel un-sated or stiffed.  And here's why: under 10 quid for a filling dinner, what a price! Plus, like the main dishes, the mushy peas and all the 'fixins' are nice.As for me? Cod and chips girl, that's my go to. And what I recommend to you. Sure they've got all the other extras and stuff. But please give it a skip, or I'm gonna call your bluff. You get so much food, cod perfectly fried and de-boned. I don't think I could finish, even were I munchie'd and stoned. But on a most recent visit I surprised myself. Embarrassed is the better word perhaps, by my bottom shelfBehaviour, and let me say: Ordered a large cod and chips and like Sinatra, I did it my way. Not sure where it goes, maybe my toes? Or perhaps I can artfully hide my foodie-butt in clothes? No shame in my game, I can put it away. Hope my metabolism keeps up till I'm at least 50!But I digress. We were talking about fish: rock, sole, plaice, pike, cod, yes they do impress. Batter fried golden, crispy, hissing, hot and brown. Fresh cut chips, ketchup, squeeze that lemon, pour on the vinegar, and baby boy go to town. But only if you're down, and now you are. Cause when it comes to food, you know this Rhymin' YelpStar Would never lead you astray, or far. So Fair Yelper: If you're near Warren Street Station, feeling the growl of hunger, annoyed. No time to be reticent or coy. Roll through that chippy on 82 Cleveland StreetAnd the next day don't hesitate to repeat. Only thing that's bad about this place is the haze, That I see when I'm hungry and they're not open on Sundays.

TABiHZOFhf9H7UxKPOoImw.text: As a hungry university student, I'm always looking for cheap, quality eats near campus.  When I'm craving fish and chips, Fish Bone hits the spot.  For a mere £4.90, you can get a decently-sized piece of perfectly-fried golden cod and chips (for take-away), and for only £1 more, you can get a warm cup of mushy peas.  The fish was cooked perfectly - flakey and golden.  A great spot for lunch.

QEAscMX5FHEYxPY0t33KOw.text: Nice, small hole-in-the-wall serving fish and chips. What a combination! Have tried both the cod and haddock, and I couldn't taste the difference. They give you free ketchup, use it. Has taken a while to get my food each time, but that's only because they do not fry the fish until you've ordered it. The nice lady I ordered from tonight gave me two small pieces of cod for the price of a large one because they had no more of the latter. It was a feast!

4bYX9ShyLoWzHe2L2bwQKg.text: British people seem to love fried fish on Friday. Does it hail back to the Catholic days of yore before some King decided to create his own religion to get a divorce? Who knows? What I do know is that the old place I worked would always have fish on Fridays, and while it was subsidized and cheap, it was also pretty terrible.So to continue the tradition at our new place of work, I found Fish Bone for fried fish Friday. We stopped in at around 12:30 and managed to get a table for five people. Now be warned, it's gets SUPER busy at lunch. After sitting there about 15 more minutes the place was fully packed and there was a queue out the door for the takeaway orders.So is it worth it? I say yes. They do a small cod portion (which is nice for lunch, because who wants to eat a giant piece of fish for lunch) and if you get it with chips, it's about £7. (I think it's £6 if you get it to go.) We also split some orders of mushy peas because they give you a nice bowlful of them. The fish is really nicely prepared with a light batter coating it. I really enjoyed the chips as well, but the two Brits in the group weren't overly impressed with them. Maybe it's a British thing. The rest of us really enjoyed everything. We'll probably come back again for fish Fridays. I mean it's not ridiculously expensive for lunch and while it's not as cheap as the food at my old job, it's about ten times as good, so the extra money is totally worth it.

iTv1lPtgporhs-cUeV1H1Q.text: I really really enjoyed the whole thing. People are so nice and very accommodating. Fish is delicious and in a big portion. Best value for money. I will definitely come back.

oTQoTiEZ-zBHenVx463v7w.text: Fish Bone is a local fish and chip shop.  It has had some good reviews so I thought I would give it a try.  I went at 6pm and the cod was already cooked so it was a little cold.  The chips were pre-cooked and cold.  I think the fryer could have provided food which was hot and fresh.  However, the mushy peas were lovely.  I suggest you eat at this fish and chip shop afer 7pm so that you get freshly cooked hot food.

p-CPJxGCF8bvF2QbcjvnxA.text: The reviews guided us here and I'm just backing them up.Skate wasn't in so I took the haddock. Diane had salad and sides. We both came away happy. As usual, I was completely turned around and we wound up walking the wrong way afterward, winding up at Oxford Circus. So yes, a little off the beaten track, but this is London - the side streets are more crowded than most cities' downtowns. However you find your way there, you'll be glad you did!

ogVd5H1vZdukys9NqrIQQg.text: Well, this was a little out the way from the shops, but we enjoyed the rainy walk. It was very nice and quiet. Mainly locals and us, all four of us had a good time

B3x6KY5ihaTXFSBbSHnVMQ.text: Looking for a quick place to grab some fish and chips?  Look no further!  To sum up Fish Bone in one word (that isn't "YUM!") I'd use "FAST!"We were greeted warmly by two employees when we walked in.  The menu was fairly standard for a fish and chips place, and ranged from cheap to slightly expensive.  From my experience, the small sizes are more than enough to fill you.I placed my order--the small cod and chips--and took out my phone to fire up Yelp so I could grab a pic.  Before I could load the Yelp page for Fish Bone, *our food was sitting in front of us.*  +10 for speediness!The cod was excellent: lightly battered and crispy, and not overly oily.  Like others here, my friend wasn't a fan of the chips but I thoroughly enjoyed them!  On the plate was a large lemon that I sprayed over everything for the extra hint of freshness, but once I found the tartar sauce and vinegar the lemon sat unused and depressed on the corner of my plate.  I'm not usually a tartar sauce fan, but this was some good stuff.  I liberally applied it to my fish (and occasionally dunked a chip in it).If you're looking for super fast, affordable, and delicious fish and (arguably) chips, Fish Bone won't disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Small cod and chips

_Pcm-GSg1JA40bUb-_vO9g.text: Tourists, take note: the best fish & chip places aren't that glamorous. They may be tucked down a side street and look questionable... but the fish (and low prices) are well worth the trip. Fish Bone is one of those places.Don't let the plain exterior, little signage, or outdated decor fool you. The fish is excellent -- fresh, hot, and homemade. We came for the take-away lunch special (which saved us a few pounds), but there's a small park, with plenty of benches, right next to the shop, as well as Regent's Park down the road.Large portion sizes for the price, made and wrapped right before us. Plenty of toppings, like salt and vinegar, and quick service. Definitely a must-go.

8qk1W3Q2gU0dwzK_DMgOEQ.text: Great take away fish and chips and best priced for the area - often eat from here but always take away. Decor inside needs some updating!

RLU_H4ZJukuoLwZyjUN-xQ.text: Fish-y interior, friendly staff and both an eat-in and take away option, this is a great place. The large cod is massive so I opted for small cod, large chips and OMG was the large chips huge! The chips seemed hand made and fresh - not the bulk standard frozen kind. The whole office was envious as I opted for take away. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom

Yw39asDWbeFIXDz8B7CnKA.text: Good chippie...clean and nice environment, decent fish and chips, really pleasant owner, cracking appetisers,had both hummous and soup before, both were really good, mushy peas decent too!

Rp4-HB3qCu0looqFFbkh2w.text: Good fish and chips here. Gigantic sized fish portions and reasonably priced especially take away.

DOocF5nlNwJFM5a-vdp-Cw.text: I came here to show some American visitors what British Fish & Chips tasted like.We arrived in an empty restaurant and our order got taken quickly however it was then a  20 minute wait for our food! During this wait about 15 take-away customers were served.Not really acceptable in a small place like this.The chips tasted really good and the fish was a good large portion, although one of my colleagues didn't like the plain batter on his.I ordered some bread to go with my chips which they forgot, then when it was brought out the top slice was dry, like it had been out on the counter all day.So, if I was passing, I would only come here again for take-away chips

XOxPKgr7eNizIWQOgZtCgA.text: Fish was wonderful - found this place late at night and grabbed their last piece. Chips were alright, nothing spectacular. Mushy peas were very, very good. Service was great, even though they were getting ready to close up.

Tg1DXw2t2jrxjHRi77xroQ.text: My experience at Fish Bone was great.  As a lover of fish and all things fish, I was happy to find my London office was just a block from here. The dining room and counter were immaculate. The staff was friendly.   Great value for what I paid, fresh and flavorful!I could, however, kick myself for not asking for some tartar sauce! The large cod is "LARGE" so the small will be for me next time.  And tartar!There's a 20 minute wait if you want your fish grilled, but the tempura breading is light and flaky and frankly, amazing. There is a £10 minimum when paying with a card.

Gl3AUTMrqEByMHbVSeBfdA.text: I agree with the reviews for this place - this is some of the best fish and chips that I've had in London!The fish is really creamy, the batter crispy and not too greasy (for deep fried food), and the chips are fat and thick.I'm often here for a quick carb pick me up, they do cheesy chips, which is an old school time favourite of mine, and I love dousing them in vinegar and eating them in the square around the corner.Portion sizes are great, I always go for the small chips, because a large portion is just too much for me. At £1.90, this is also a complete bargain!The greatest standout for me is also the vibe, the restaurant is really lovely and clean, well decorated and fresh, and the staff are just so friendly and approachable. It's easy to have a conversation with them and I really feel like I'm welcome.

BBfqz4SqGpvnhByvCVfwdg.text: I've been in this place in September 2015.The restaurant itself is a simple one, not very charming but functional. It's a classic fish 'n' chips shop ran by a very friendly macedonian owner.I really enjoyed the food. We had an haddock with chips and it was tasty, not at all as strong-smelling as I thought it would be.A photo of the menu is attatched, as well as one displaying some stickers on the door from the Government department charged of evaluating the hygene (the restaurant scored 4 out of 5).Be aware that there's a relevant difference in price between the take-away formula (around 7£) and the service at tables (around 10£). The owner remarked that before taking the order however, so the service was quite fair.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Haddock and chips
Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Chips award

oVc_CUuuTTLND8BO67niSQ.text: Really excellent fish--best I had during my two weeks in the UK! Bit of a hole in the wall, so it's nothing fancy, but the service was friendly and the food was very good and inexpensive--worth seeking out!

LaNdLHoWhrpA5wWpuescCw.text: Excellent food, at an even better price! Great for backpackers. You should definitely come check it out. Great service as well, very friendly and helpful

yc_OzPiqlCRADn_TlfPFtQ.text: One if the better Fish 'n Chips that I've had in London but be careful ...I nearly burned my mouth on that freshly fried fish! :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom

A4vFIAWotT2Dz2R_StAQgg.text: Amazing food ! First time here, from presentation of the food to the presentation of the place , hands down a really good place to go to if your looking for fried fish and fries. The staff is REALLY friendly and are not pushy like other places asking you if your done with your plate , Truly a very good place to go if you're in the area. It's laid back not fancy but very good decor! Just try it !

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Best fish and chips

s_eaEDWq-daqbU4shkIgsw.text: Very small establishment with a good selection of fish. The fish is good and fried very well. We also got calamari but it wasn't the best. The pieces of fish are well sized and the prices are fair.

YcD3tH72aMA8xdfJGuPm4w.text: We got the fish and chips and it was delicious! I'm not saying I'm an expert (just a Californian touring good ol' London) but the fish was light  and crispy. The small cod itself was a a very decent size and the regular was even bigger. My fiance and I ordered the sticky toffee cake with custard and a side of vanilla bean ice cream. Perfect end to our meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee cake with custard and a side of vanilla bean icecream , the picture doesn't capture how delicious this cake was
Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Great fish and chips!

_NhU-wV3en0gRvP5dJjukA.text: Excellent fish and chips. We had the haddock and the cod.  Both were fresh and cooked to perfection.  I'd highly recommend this place.

FvCiknxLB5iBv3DWyx8KLQ.text: After a recommendation from a friend studying in the city, I could not leave the city without some local fish n' chips, which is why I literally walked 2 miles for this stuff. The location is inner city, brushing northern SOHO, with some separation from the traffic-heavy tourist areas. There's no shame in eating a meal with yourself, especially when it was as hearty as this.Of course I opted for the main dish - the sit-down fish (cod) and chips, with an additional mushy-peas on the side and a coffee. Take note: sitting in is a bit more pricey than take-away. The interior is friendly, with plenty of sit-in space. I chose to enjoy my meal outside on the outdoor tables. By the time I sat down to eat, I was so depleted I inhaled the food in 10 minutes...and mind you these platters are not small. The fried cod and mushy peas pleased my belly the best, though the flavor could use more amplitude (I ended up using half the ketchup bottle). Fries were standard - homemade flavor, soft and average. All-in-all, if you're wandering the area (perhaps SOHO) and suddenly become seized with a craving for fish 'n chips, this is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom

sm2BSrOHhqSd2LdGYuM7CQ.text: As a New Yorker, I try to find as many fish and chip restaurants as possible and this is by far the best fish and chips I've ever had. They give you lots of chips and a pretty big piece of cod for really great prices. Will definitely be back while I'm here! So delicious

7xH8iAr8FpM4NL_Z6I7vYA.text: Great fish and chips at reasonable prices !  Felt more like a  cafeteria than a restaurant but we didn't care- we went for the food and were very happy.

qSWnGzCDm3C9rdVBATJHkQ.text: While we were venturing around different parts of London we came across this place and decided to stop and try it. We both ordered the Cod Fish with chips. They were absolutely delicious!! Very fresh and tasty. I would definitely come back here again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom

kQlLaKp0HJk3QgXi597sTA.text: Walked 15 mins to get to Fishbone after the positive reviews and I wasn't disappointed. A great chippy. Away from the busy main streets, it felt like I was in stepping into some authentic London. Cod fantastic. Chips ok. Throw on some salt and vinegar and bob's your uncle. Reasonably priced as well.

ZJzUIZAp6zdwaacYGNl74w.text: Couldn't ask for more. Delightfully prepared and ample portions. Don't skip the mushy peas

-9AAddDtUzyU14lXj-tgbA.text: A little bit further out from the centre (closer to Regent's Park) compared to Gig's (which I gave four stars to) but I'd say just edges it for me. Smaller and not as pleasing on the eye as Gig's, Fish Bone has its own charm. Perfectly cooked fish n chips though you may find you'll be waiting a little longer than expected as everything is cooked to order. I'd give Fish Bone an extra half star if I could to reflect I think they just pip Gig's to the central London chippie crown!

3Q0_8MRaOPDhhBsJ0T0uZA.text: I was mislead to believe this restaurant had a classic pub/British vibe. Food and service are subpar

qBYQofKH00Iqwfar7ynFvw.text: Probably the best fish & chips in London. Fresh perfectly cooked Cod and nice size portion of chips. The guys who work here and really friendly and quick with service

o6j6TCru9XMpaIFhDGVu9Q.text: For me the best fish and chips in a town. Fish is fresh and very tasty. I'm notka huge fan of fish and chips but from time to time I need to have one. I will come back to try calamari

dAcY6anxXy8jlwtdRVEBeg.text: Yum!This is my favorite fish & chips place in London because it's close to Regent's Park (so you can bring your food there on a nice day) and because the portions are huge but the prices are reasonable.The staff is really friendly and nice and the interior was recently renovated (within the past few years) so that it looks a bit "fancier" (not 5-star, but less grungy than it did before).Everything I've had has been really yummy (cod, rock, and skate). The fish is fresh and the batter is light and crisp and airy. The chips are sort of weirdly chunky but some people like that.I like to generously douse my fish & chips with malt vinegar and I love asking for a gherkin on the side.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom

uRTzbuglABkwzmY1TpO2vQ.text: Uhm. Go here. Eat delicious food. End of story.  Except not. The people were wonderful, too! My hubby found a gem and treated me to one of my favorite dinners. Try the beer from Cyprus!

tq2C0YONRjBPbLxQ-f-63A.text: The fish was crispy, chips were kinda crispy. It was my first time eating fish and chips. I prefer the fries and fried chicken back home to be honest. I bought a meat pie today June 22 but halfway through I noticed the date on the wrapper says June 19.. :/

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom

9toy-1zMRFSKms1Womatlg.text: Had the haddock and chips.  Good piece of fish.  Not greasy.  Plenty of seating in the back room, as well as on the sidewalk.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom

R2SL-z5FPLr0M9aagGhqVw.text: We loved it! Friendly and fast service and amazing fish! It's little and very casual but everyone there was nice and friendly even though we were a group of jet lagged Americans.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Little inside song or you can go with tske away
Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. We had haddock and cod. The cod was preferred.
Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Casual restaurant. Amazing fish and chips , friendly service! We will be back !

RflUDk-gEXfs51GVdom2mQ.text: Far and away, the BEST fish and chips I've ever had. Bar none!!!  So, so damn good.  I ordered the Haddock.  The chips/fries were ok, but I was there for the fish.  I've NEVER had fish and chips that weren't at least a little greasy.  Swear to G-d, not a drip of cooking oil.n the plate or my fingers.    The filet was so moist and tender on the inside and crispy and flavorful on the outside.  Alexandra is the owner. She's a sweetheart working her ass off.  Always with a smile.  I can't wait to go back...

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom

4gXT-C-6-G2T10RkH2BgzQ.text: This was the most friendly and helpful staff you will ever find anywhere! The fish n chips were amazing and the price was more than reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. GraceLife London team visiting Fish Bone. The people running this place were so friendly and helpful! We had to take a picture with them.

o9NISy9cJEDDmn_xit07Mg.text: We came here for lunch and decided to eat onsite.I had the haddock with chips.Very good fish. Perfectly fried, not too greasy. Big portion size.The chips were just OK - I like my fries more crispy.The homemade tartar sauce was quite enjoyable.Very friendly service - the owner made a point to talk to us about where we are from, how we found his business, where the fish is being caught, etc. Prices are quite fair for the amount of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Haddock and chips

8nYCfpwY58QoWogSgutH-w.text: Fish and chips were amazing the owner was very nice. We got the cod with chips and curry. Everything was amazing.

P4DNuSkiT_QxFog2DHRuzg.text: Fabulous. Fish was crispy, not greasy. Chips we're crispy and hot. We ate in, and weren't very hungry so we each ordered the small cod. It was so good, we were wishing for more. Definitely worth another visit.

JVFZCesETrWOMcG7_L13ow.text: The one thing we hadn't done in London was get some real Fish & Chips.  Since we came back from Paris via St. Pancras, my daughter Yelped this place which was a short tube ride and walk from the station.  I liked that it was off the beaten path and seemed like a place locals would go as opposed to another tourist hangout.We got the Cod and Chips and it was just what we wanted.  Nothing fancy; just the classic English Pub plate to wrap up two weeks in Europe.  Friendly service and VERY reasonably priced.  There are probably better, fancier places o be had, but this seemed like the way to go for authenticity.

FbGVkVILNVYSNSGkqGx0kA.text: It's just so-so.  I went for dinner take-out. I wanted some fish and chips to take back to my room.  The fish had been sitting under heat lamps for a while, so it really wasn't very crispy and it was kind of stale by the time I got to it.  The chips were pretty soggy. I like mine with a little crispy exterior on them. The thing that really bothered me was the fact that they sell condiments for takeaway.  The prices overall are very reasonable, so I guess selling condiments is one way they can make up for it. But it still bothers me that you have to pay extra for a cup of ketchup.  I'll wager that this little restaurant is much better for lunch. But as a dinner option, visit one of the local pubs you'll be much happier.

y0a8OoG9sv_vHBnW77IqEA.text: Not my first choice in London for a cosy pub with fishnchips and a beer. I'm curious how it was in the past without liquor. Now the food is more expensive. My entree was the tender fish -plaice, which was destroyed by the clumpy batter. Order cod for fish and chips and you'll be more than satisfied. They only serve bottled beer and have excellent fish choices.

doTicaOaTnXMrZVjTV9cSw.text: After walking in a spiral trying to find the place without a proper map or wifi, I finally came upon Fish Bone. There are a couple of tables outside, three in front of the counter and a bunch in the back dining room. I asked the gentleman at the front what kind of fish he recommended for fish and chips. He was very sweet and had a bit of a sheepish smile, probably trying not to laugh at just how touristy I was being and the American accent to top it off. He said the cod and the haddock were both great but I went with the cod since it was the only one available in a small size. He also asked if I'd have anything to drink and I said, sure a beer. I thought I'd get something local but he offered up a bottle of Stella -- no draughts here. Perhaps Stella is a local favorite; the dude beside me was drinking one too. The fish was great. It was salted and the batter actually had flavor (this was not the case the last time I visited London and had fish and chips). The mushy peas had a fair amount of acidity (tasted of lemon) which I didn't expect and it definitely helped cut through the heaviness of the fry and the tartar sauce...but not my favorite preparation of peas. The fries were typical British fries, no salt and no real flavor. They weren't soggy though so probably successful British fries, just very different from how Americans are accustomed. A heavy hand with the salt shaker and alternating between the vinegar and more tartar sauce certainly helped. Seemed most folks outside and in the dining room were tourists. The dude beside me who was pretty much just hanging out with his iPad and talking with the owners and also the folks who got their f&c take away were the locals -- it was pretty clear! The pricing on the wall is only for take away: small cod £4.4, small chips £2 and mushy peas £1. My eat in order plus the beer was £13.2. Overall, a cute little no-frills mom n' pop place with very good fried fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Fish n chips with mushy peas

hLxncmTJ2_f8ToyyQCwHXg.text: We ordered cod and haddock with chips. The food are as good as i expected from other reviews.The owner is very friendly when he explained what to order. In addition we ordered sticky toffee pudding which is a good ending to our meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom

YDUaX70dgyiOP8wc568SOg.text: Omggggg!!! As soon as we left the airport we took the Underground straight here. After reading all the reviews I was so excited for my first official fish and chip experience! Fish Bone does not disappoint! Came after the lunch rush mostly people were getting take out when we arrived. It was a nice day so we opted to sit outside. My husband and I both got the lunch special, large piece of fish, chips, mushy peas and a beer for 14£. Huge piece of fish is given (either Haddock or Cod, both delicious!!!!) great portion of chips and soup cup full of peas. Everything was SUPER fresh, kudos to cook!! Our server was also super friendly and asked if we found out about them through Yelp lol! If you want a real authentic fish and chip experience go here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Ohhhh yeaaaa!!!

HRG6s8CokaByQL9_PM1vPQ.text: Straight up whole in the wall and local spot. Although by the time we got there, it was totally empty and dead. But this was not an indication of the food and service. I picked the cod. The fish was extremely fresh and cooked perfectly. The staff were very friendly as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Cod and chips! Outstanding.

xFW0BoMmkNjwHksmI9mn9Q.text: Fantastic fish and chips.  Had the haddock and couldn't stop commenting about how good it was throughout the meal.  We liked it so much, we came back and ate there for a second time during our trip thru London, Edinburgh, and Cardiff.  Please go and you will be pleased at the quality and quantity of fish.

VTr1nsEPfQcfz_Ual0pCHA.text: Fishbone serves fish & chips in London. It's an old fashioned shop, not trendy with a gorgeous odd decor.  You can order a slice of bread and butter to make a chip butty! Excellent wheelchair access. The owner was lovely and very warm and friendly. The food was delicious with crunchy chips and lightly battered fish. I found the regular size a bit large as the serving sizes are generous.  Highly recommended to either eat in or takeaway.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. The menu! Or part of it showing the bread and butter at least:)
Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Wheelchair access is via a ramped entrance.
Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. This is a chip butty ready to be folded in half and eaten with glee!

anV-RKW30kf1pnPf51kMKA.text: Fish Bone was as spontaneous find hidden in Fitztrovia. The staff is super friendly and the food is delish. We stopped inside later in the evening before closing and they still had a great selection. The woman who took our orders was extremely friendly and kind to answer our questions. The fish was cooked very well and breaded perfectly. The side dishes was a perfect add to the fish and chips. Overall, a lovely environment for a quiet dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips with mash peas
Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Meat pie
Photo of Fish Bone - London, United Kingdom. Lovely ginger beer

75gb2SjgeXt6A_w5WZJWlQ.text: The service here was horrible...the men working are very rude. The fish was really good but the fries kind of tasted like cardboard. I would recommend just for the fish, however maybe order takeout so you do not have to deal with the poor service.
